reasoning.question: Are the two red telephone booths located on the same side of the street or on opposite sides?
reasoning.reasoning_chain: By examining the panoramic image, we see one red telephone booth in the foreground, close to the building with arched windows (left side of the image). The street is on the right side of both booths, suggesting they are on the same side.
reasoning.final_answer: The two red telephone booths are located on the same side of the street.

reasoning.question: Which direction are the majority of the parked cars facing relative to the viewer’s vantage point?
reasoning.reasoning_chain: There are two visible parked cars on the right-hand side of the panoramic image. The road markings and curb alignments confirm the direction of travel and parking, indicating that the cars are facing in the direction away from where the viewer is standing.
reasoning.final_answer: The majority of the parked cars are facing away from the viewer’s vantage point.

This is the street that runs horizontally across the panorama, towards the buildings on the right side of the image.
reasoning.final_answer: They will be facing the main street that runs from left to right in the image foreground.
